item.title: CAPPS 2026 Powers Data-Driven CNC Manufacturing
item.description: Applied Automation Technologies released CAPPS 2026, advancing on-machine metrology with improved laser scanning integration and automated process control for CNC manufacturing.

item.title: $124M Investment Funds Machina Labsâ€™ First Large-Scale Intelligent Factory
item.description: Machina Labs secured $124M Series C funding to build a large-scale intelligent factory using robotic manufacturing cells, signaling major growth in software-defined production infrastructure.

item.title: Orbbec and Robbyant Set a New Benchmark in Robotic Depth Perception
item.description: Orbbec partners with Robbyant to optimize spatial perception models for its Gemini 330 stereo depth cameras, enhancing reliability for commercial robotic vision applications.

item.title: Machine Vision Lighting Solutions for Unwanted Glare
item.description: CCS America details lighting strategies (shrouding, polarization, overdriving) to eliminate glare in machine vision inspection systems.

item.title: Advancing Robotics with 3D Vision, AI, and Edge Computing
item.description: Teledyne Vision Systems discusses the convergence of AI, 3D vision, and edge computing to enable smarter, adaptive robotics in industrial automation.

item.title: Camera Powers Lens-Coupled High-Speed X-Ray Imager
item.description: Allied Vision's EoSens 1.1CXP2 high-speed CMOS camera selected as the core imaging engine for a new real-time 4D X-ray CT system.

item.title: Harnessing AI to Detect Anomalies During Aircraft Wing Manufacture
item.description: Loughborough University's AVRRC develops AI-based anomaly detection using synthetic data to augment human inspection in aircraft wing manufacturing.
